thread.title: Aust dollar jumps above US71c
thread.title_full: Aust dollar jumps above US71c | Business Spectator

author: AAP
title: Aust dollar jumps above US71c
text:
The Australian dollar is back above US71c for the first time in two weeks, getting support from some strong Chinese economic data.
At 12.00pm (AEST) on Monday, the currency was trading at US71.20c, up from US70.61c on Friday.
During the morning, it peaked at US71.36c, its highest level since September 1.
Chinese retail spending rose by 10.8 per cent in the 12 months to August, which beat market expectations.
OANDA Australia and Asia Pacific senior trader Stephen Innes said the Chinese data and Tuesday's release of the Reserve Bank board meeting minutes will get the Australian dollar off to a strong start this week.
"Overall, the data does support the notion that the recent People's Bank of China (PBoC) easing policies are starting to filter through the economy," he said.
"The RBA will release its monetary policy minutes tomorrow, which may also be supportive for the Aussie. I expect the RBA to reinforce the notion that they have shifted to a neutral stance."
